snippet: The outcome of the presidential election might help determine how many audits the Internal Revenue Service conducts and whether they're aimed more at individuals or corporations, if historical patterns hold, an economist writes.
abstract: The outcome of the presidential election might help determine how many audits the Internal Revenue Service conducts and whether they're aimed more at individuals or corporations, if historical patterns hold, an economist writes.

headline.main: Will the I.R.S. Be Busy Next Year?
